block.p: Elizabeth Lloyd Clark, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard Hanley Clark of Blue Bell, Pa., was married yesterday to Courtney West, a son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Olin Leslie West Jr., who lived in Bryn Mawr, Pa. The Rev. Marek Zabriskie performed the ceremony at St. Thomas' Episcopal Church in Whitemarsh, Pa.

The bride, 48, is a business development consultant in Alexandria, Va. She graduated from Sophie Newcomb College at Tulane University and received an M.B.A. degree from Tulane. Her father, who retired as the director of investor relations for SPS Technologies, a manufacturer of fasteners and precision components in Jenkintown, Pa., is now a manufacturers' representative for pharmaceutical equipment in Blue Bell. Her mother, Elizabeth Evelyn Clark, retired as an adjunct professor of sociology at Beaver College in Glenside, Pa.

Elizabeth Lloyd Clark, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard Hanley Clark of Blue Bell, Pa., was married yesterday to Courtney West, a son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Olin Leslie West Jr., who lived in Bryn Mawr, Pa. The Rev. Marek Zabriskie performed the ceremony at St. Thomas' Episcopal Church in Whitemarsh, Pa.

The bride, 48, is a business development consultant in Alexandria, Va. She graduated from Sophie Newcomb College at Tulane University and received an M.B.A. degree from Tulane. Her father, who retired as the director of investor relations for SPS Technologies, a manufacturer of fasteners and precision components in Jenkintown, Pa., is now a manufacturers' representative for pharmaceutical equipment in Blue Bell. Her mother, Elizabeth Evelyn Clark, retired as an adjunct professor of sociology at Beaver College in Glenside, Pa.

The bridegroom, 55, is a special agent for the Federal Bureau of Investigation in Washington. He graduated from the University of South Carolina. His father was a manufacturers' representative dealing in raw materials in Bryn Mawr. The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce.
